section.title: Waf installation
section.para:
Waf does not need to be installed. There are many advantages of not installing Waf, among them:
Waf is very small (80kB) Different projects use different Waf versions, it is better to ship the script for users The latest Waf version might change and the users would complain
To generate the Waf script from the sources, use the following command:
$ ./waf-light --make-waf --strip
Once the waf script is generated, you may redistribute it freely (bsd licence)

section.title: Waf installation (2)
section.para:
If you really want to install the Waf application on the system (despite the advantages enumerated in the previous section), you may use the following command on unix-like systems such as Linux:
# ./waf-light install --prefix=/tmp/
Root priviledges may be required depending on the final location.

section.title: Common wrappers
section.para: The wrapper scripts are provided for those used to run ./configure and make on unix-like systems
